question: A train covers a distance of 10 km in 12 minutes. If its speed is decreased by 5 km/hr, the time taken by it to cover the same distance will be :
explanation:
Speed of train $latex = \\frac{Distance}{Time}&s=1$
$latex =\\frac{10}{\\frac{12}{60}}km/h&s=1$
$latex =\\frac{10\\times 60}{12} = 50km/h&s=1$
New Speed $latex = 45km/h&s=1$
âˆ´ Required Time $latex = \\frac{10}{45}hour&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{2}{9}\\times 60 minutes&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{40}{3} minutes&s=1$
$latex = 13 minutes 20 seconds$
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
